title: Chicken Spiedies (Lemon- and Herb-Marinated Grilled Chicken Sandwiches) Recipe
full_text:
Chicken Spiedies (Lemon- and Herb-Marinated Grilled Chicken Sandwiches) Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
40 mins
Cook
10 mins
Active
45 mins
Marinating Time
8 hrs
Total
8 hrs 50 mins
Serves
6 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1/2
cup
olive oil
1/4
cup
white vinegar
1/4
cup
freshly squeezed juice
from about
3
lemons
2
tablespoons
finely chopped
fresh parsley
2
tablespoons
finely
chopped fresh basil
1
tablespoon
finely chopped fresh mint
2
teaspoons
dried oregano
2
medium
cloves minced garlic
(about
2
teaspoons
)
Kosher salt
and freshly ground black pepper
1 1/2
pounds
boneless skinless chicken breasts
, cut into 1-inch cubes
6
soft Italian rolls
Directions
To make marinade, whisk together oil, vinegar, lemon juice, parsley, basil, mint, oregano, and garlic. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Place chicken in large resealable plastic bag. Pour in marinade, seal, and toss to combine. Place in refrigerator and allow to marinate for at least overnight, up to 3 days.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
If using wooden skewers, soak in water for at least 30 minutes.
When ready to cook, thread chicken onto skewers, dividing meat equally between each skewer.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Light one chimney full of charcoal.
When all the charcoal is lit and covered with gray ash, pour out and spread the coals evenly over coal grate. Alternatively, set all the burners of a gas grill to medium-high heat. Set cooking grate in place, cover grill and allow to preheat for 5 minutes.
Clean and oil
grilling grate. Grill skewers until chicken is browned on all sides and cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Open roll and lay grilled skewer inside. Gripping the roll at the bottom, carefully slide skewer off, leaving meat in the bread. Serve immediately.
Special Equipment
Grill
, 6 wooden skewers
